column2: Authors
column3: Title
column5: Notes

column2: Raventos, Jose; Wiegand, Thorsten; Maestre, Fernando T.; de Luis, Martin
column3: A resprouter herb reduces negative density-dependent effects among neighboring seeders after fire
column5: Looks at density-dependence with mortality with mentions of facilitation and density in the discussion of the paper

column2: Westphal, Michael F.; Noble, Taylor; Butterfield, Harry Scott; Lortie, Christopher J.
column3: A test of desert shrub facilitation via radiotelemetric monitoring of a diurnal lizard
column5: Paper does talk about the density of shrubs in the study site and the facilitation

column2: Miao, Renhui; Qiu, Xueli; Guo, Meixia; Musa, Ala; Jiang, Deming
column3: Accuracy of space-for-time substitution for vegetation state prediction following shrub restoration
column5: Shrub density is mentioned but might not be the greatest paper for shrub density and facilitation

column2: Porensky, Lauren M.; Leger, Elizabeth A.; Davison, Jay; Miller, W. Wally; Goergen, Erin M.; Espeland, Erin K.; Carroll-Moore, Erin M.
column3: Arid old-field restoration: Native perennial grasses suppress weeds and erosion, but also suppress native shrubs
column5: Looks both at shrub density and its association with facilitation it seems like a good paper

column2: Rodriguez-Buritica, Susana; Miriti, Maria N.
column3: Biting the hand that feeds: the invasive grass Schismus barbatus (Poaceae) is facilitated by, but reduces establishment of, the native shrub Ambrosia dumosa (Asteraceae)
column5: More focused on the density of the invasive grass over the shrub but does talk about the facilitation in this interaction

column2: Burnham, Katharine M.; Lee, Thomas D.
column3: Canopy gaps facilitate establishment, growth, and reproduction of invasive Frangula alnus in a Tsuga canadensis dominated forest
column5: might be a good paper to include. Looks at buckthorn and density with facilitation

column2: Forbes, Adam
column3: Canopy manipulations of exotic Bitter Willow (Salix elaeagnos) forest for indigenous seedling recruitment: A pilot study
column5: Another buckthorn paper with density included and facilitation

column2: Mclaren, Brian E.; Gammond, Peter R.; Thompson, Ian D.
column3: Characteristics of the boreal mixedwood forest associated with the use of subnivean access points by American martens
column5: Directly looks at shrub density in relation with other vegetation species and the relations with them

column2: Hughes, Nicole M.; Johnson, Daniel M.; Akhalkatsi, Maia; Abdaladze, Otar
column3: Characterizing Betula litwinowii Seeding Microsites at the Alpine-Treeline Ecotone, Central Greater Caucasus Mountains, Georgia
column5: Paper does look at shrub density but mainly the juveniles of R. Caucasium

column2: Swaffer, Brooke A.; Holland, Kate L.
column3: Comparing ecophysiological traits and evapotranspiration of an invasive exotic, Pinus halepensis in native woodland overlying a karst aquifer
column5: Paper looks at facilitation of water intake with some tree species and of shrub speceis (halepensis) and does look at its density

column2: Esteso-Martinez, Jordan; Camarero, J. Julio; Gil-Pelegrin, Eustaquio
column3: Competitive effects of herbs on Quercus faginea seedlings inferred from vulnerability curves and spatial-pattern analyses in a Mediterranean stand (Iberian System, northeast Spain)
column5: Paper does look at facilitative interaction between herbs and OAK density but nothing to do with shrubs

column2: Loayza, Andrea P.; Herrera-Madariaga, Marisol A.; Carvajal, Danny E.; Garcia-Guzman, Patricio; Squeo, Francisco A.
column3: Conspecific plants are better 'nurses' than rocks: consistent results revealing intraspecific facilitation as a process that promotes establishment in a hyper-arid environment
column5: Looks at indirect interactions between rocks and shrubs in study area and if there is an affect on the density

column2: Yoshihara, Yu; Sasaki, Takehiro; Okuro, Toshiya; Undarmaa, Jamsran; Takeuchi, Kazuhiko
column3: Cross-spatial-scale patterns in the facilitative effect of shrubs and potential for restoration of desert steppe
column5: Excellent paper and follows all criteria

column2: Arcese, P.; Schuster, R.; Campbell, L.; Barber, A.; Martin, T. G.
column3: Deer density and plant palatability predict shrub cover, richness, diversity and aboriginal food value in a North American archipelago
column5: Looks at deer density not shrub density so this would not be a good paper to use

column2: Casper, BB
column3: Demographic consequences of drought in the herbaceous perennial Cryptantha flava: Effects of density, associations with shrubs, and plant size
column5: Looks more at a plant species and its relation to shrub and open areas. It mighttttt be good

column2: Decuyper, Mathieu; Slim, Pieter A.; Van Loon-Steensma, Jantsje M.
column3: Dendrochronology of Atriplex portulacoides and Artemisia maritima in Wadden Sea salt marshes
column5: Paper does look at animal density per hector but not of shrub density and relationship with facilitation. Looks more at sturcture of the plants themselves on a cellular level

column2: Gholami, Shaieste; Saadat, Latifeh; Sayad, Ehsan
column3: Different microhabitats have contrasting effects on the spatial distribution of tree regeneration density and diversity
column5: Looks at density of tree species not shrub species, there is only mention of shrubs in the background portion of the paper where their canopy is the topic of discussion

column2: Carlo, Tomas A.; Tewksbury, Joshua J.
column3: Directness and tempo of avian seed dispersal increases emergence of wild chiltepins in desert grasslands
column5: Looks at seed and seedling density but not necessarily shrub density and facilitation

column2: Lara-Romero, Carlos; Gusman-M, Elizabeth; Ramon, Pablo; Velez-Morac, Diego; Ivan Espinosac, Carlos
column3: Does size matter? Ontogenetic responses of an Andean shrub to conspecific density-dependence
column5: Petty good paper that looks at shrub size, interactions and density itself. Might be fairly usefull for paper.

column2: Pang, Chun-chiu; Ma, Xoni Kwan-Ki; Hung, Tony Tun-hei; Hau, Billy Chi-hang
column3: Early ecological succession on landslide trails, Hong Kong, China
column5: Looks at restoration with regards to shrub bensity and richness in the study area. More focus on species richness and stem density than shrub population density

column2: Fowler, Norma L.; Best, Christopher F.; Price, Dana M.; Hempel, Alice L.
column3: ECOLOGICAL REQUIREMENTS OF THE ZAPATA BLADDERPOD PHYSARIA THAMNOPHILA, AN ENDANGERED TAMAULIPAN THORNSCRUB PLANT
column5: Looks at shrub association with density of plants. It does take a look at density of shrub seedlings and adults in this paper as well as looks at facilatative interactions

column2: Farzam, Mohammad; Ejtehadi, Hamid
column3: Effects of drought and slope aspect on canopy facilitation in a mountainous rangeland
column5: Looks at shrub camopy and a little bit of shrub density but not too much. Does talk about shrub seedling density though

column2: Noumi, Zouhaier
column3: Effects of exotic and endogenous shrubs on understory vegetation and soil nutrients in the south of Tunisia
column5: Pretty good paper looking at various species of shrubs and density is recorded in them

column2: Nottebrock, Henning; Esler, Karen J.; Schurr, Frank M.
column3: Effects of intraspecific and community density on the lifetime fecundity of long-lived shrubs
column5: Looks at the density of various shrub species I africa. There are measurments and values in this pdf. I think it would be an excellent addition

column2: Senfeldr, Martin; Treml, Vaclav; Madera, Petr; Volarik, Daniel
column3: Effects of Prostrate Dwarf Pine on Norway Spruce Clonal Groups in the Treeline Ecotone of the Hruby Jesenik Mountains, Czech Republic
column5: Looks ate relationship between shrub and tree density in ecosystem and how the shrub density can facilitate the larger growth height of the tree species

column2: Hamilton, Bryan T.; Roeder, Beverly L.; Horner, Margaret A.
column3: Effects of Sagebrush Restoration and Conifer Encroachment on Small Mammal Diversity in Sagebrush Ecosystem
column5: Looks at sage bush restoration and how it will facilitate a larger density of shrub and plants to be experienced. Does have some data for density

column2: Spiegel, Orr; Nathan, Ran
column3: Empirical evaluation of directed dispersal and density-dependent effects across successive recruitment phases
column5: Looks at density-dependent competition and facilitation with shrub species, both inter and intraspecific

column2: Zhang, Gefei; Zhao, Wenzhi; Zhou, Hai; Yang, Qiyue; Wang, Xiaofen
column3: Extreme drought stress shifts net facilitation to neutral interactions between shrubs and sub-canopy plants in an arid desert
column5: Looks at individual shrub density and bulk density. Does not seem to entirely look at density of numerous species in an area but density is recorded with facilitation in mind

column2: Angelica Gomez-Ruiz, Pilar; Lindig-Cisneros, Roberto; Vargas-Rios, Orlando
column3: Facilitation among plants: A strategy for the ecological restoration of the high-andean forest (Bogota, DC-Colombia)
column5: Does look at shrub density (medium level) and looks at facilitative interactions. Has data that can be used

column2: Li, XD; Wilson, SD
column3: Facilitation among woody plants establishing in an old field
column5: Looks at density of shrub species as well as plant species. Also looks at transplanting the shrubs from one area to another and the facilitation of other plant growth

column2: Bueno, Andrea; Llambi, Luis D.
column3: Facilitation and edge effects influence vegetation regeneration in old-fields at the tropical Andean forest line
column5: Looks at tree density under shrub canopies. Does not take shrub density into consideration but does have some sort of density measurements

column2: Henriquez, JM; Lusk, CH
column3: Facilitation of Nothofagus antarctica (Fagaceae) seedlings by the prostrate shrub Empetrum rubrum (Empetraceae) on glacial moraines in Patagonia
column5: Looks at shrub seedling density but not shrub density itself. Does mentiaon facilitation and such. Maybe use.

column2: Gusman-M, Elizabeth; de la Cruz, Marcelino; Espinosa, Carlos Ivan; Escudero, Adrian
column3: Focusing on individual species reveals the specific nature of assembly mechanisms in a tropical dry-forest
column5: Has density of both trees and shrubs in  a hector area. They are included together in the same measurment. Also connects facilitative interactions with this density.

column2: Waitz, Yoni; Cohen, Yafit; Dorman, Michael; Perevolotsky, Avi
column3: From microsite selection to population spatial distribution: Pinus halepensis colonization in mediterranean-type ecosystems
column5: Paper largly focuses on tree density and ignores shrub density itself

column2: Liczner, Amanda R.; Sotomayor, Diego A.; Filazzola, Alessandro; Lortie, Christopher J.
column3: Germination response of desert annuals to shrub facilitation is species specific but not ecotypic
column5: Ppaer looks to see if the positive interactions that are experienced between shrubs and annuals will influnce the total density of annuals. No mention of shrub density though

column2: Liu, Rentao; Liu, Jianan; Zhao, Juan; Xi, Weihua; Yang, Zhimin
column3: Ground-active arthropod recovery in response to size of shrub plantations in a desertified grassland ecosystem
column5: Looks at various aspects of shrubs such as canopy size, canopy cover, and other aspects and how it affects the denity of athropods under them. Not density of shrubs themselves

column2: Garcia-Cervigon, Ana I.; Gazol, Antonio; Sanz, Virginia; Julio Camarero, J.; Miguel Olano, Jose
column3: Intraspecific competition replaces interspecific facilitation as abiotic stress decreases: The shifting nature of plant-plant interactions
column5: Ppaer does look at high density of shrubs and its affect on the facilitating seedling establishment. No measurments of density but does show that the high density of the shrub is taken into consideration

column2: Gavinet, Jordane; Prevosto, Bernard; Fernandez, Catherine
column3: Introducing resprouters to enhance Mediterranean forest resilience: importance of functional traits to select species according to a gradient of pine density
column5: Looks at abundance of shrubs under different densities of white pine covers. Paper does not specifically look at density of shrubs themselves but does have shrub measurment with pines.

column2: Osem, Yagil; Fogel, Tom; Moshe, Yossi; Brant, Shlomo
column3: Managing cattle grazing and overstorey cover for the conversion of pine monocultures into mixed Mediterranean woodlands
column5: While shrub species are measured in the paper, density is more heavily focused on with Pines that it is with the srhubs itself. Might be useful to display that density is measure but ignores shrub density

column2: Watling, James I.; Orrock, John L.
column3: Measuring edge contrast using biotic criteria helps define edge effects on the density of an invasive plant
column5: Does take into consideration some shrub density and has a bit of measurments but mainly focuses on edge density

column2: Hobbs, Trevor J.; Neumann, Craig R.; Meyer, Wayne S.; Moon, Travis; Bryan, Brett A.
column3: Models of reforestation productivity and carbon sequestration for land use and climate change adaptation planning in South Australia
column5: Paper looks at plant density and includes all plants, shrubs and trees in these measurements. Might be a good idea to use.

column2: Davies, Kirk W.; Bates, Jonathan D.; Nafus, Aleta M.
column3: Mowing Wyoming Big Sagebrush Communities With Degraded Herbaceous Understories: Has a Threshold Been Crossed?
column5: Actually looks at shrub density and gives methedology for how they measured it (Transect). Looks also at brome in shrubland so could be a super good paper!

column2: Andivia, Enrique; Villar-Salvador, Pedro; Tovar, Liliana; Rabasa, Sonia; Rey Benayas, Jose M.
column3: Multiscale assessment of woody species recruitment in Mediterranean shrublands: facilitation and beyond
column5: Looks at the density of Retama Shrubland. Measured individual shrubs in transects and found density of them.Does not specifically have density datasets but still seems like a good paper to add

column2: Dolezal, J; St'astna, P; Hara, T; Srutek, M
column3: Neighbourhood interactions and environmental factors influencing old-pasture succession in the Central Pyrenees
column5: Paper looks more at the density of trees than the density of shrubs. Does have facilitation in the paper but not density measurement for shrubs in it

column2: James, Cassandra S.; Capon, Samantha J.; Quinn, Gerry P.
column3: Nurse plant effects of a dominant shrub (Duma florulenta) on understorey vegetation in a large, semi-arid wetland in relation to flood frequency and drying
column5: Paper looks at density of species that are shrub and non shrub. Associates it back to facilitation and also has a measurement for it.

column2: Mellado, Ana; Zamora, Regino
column3: Parasites structuring ecological communities: The mistletoe footprint in Mediterranean pine forests
column5: Not really the greatest paper to use. Mentions shrub, density and facilitation a total of like 5 times. No actual data in text so exclude paper

column2: Sun, Zhongyu; Huang, Yuhui; Yang, Long; Schaefer, Val; Chen, Yanqiao
column3: Plantation age, understory vegetation, and species-specific traits of target seedlings alter the competition and facilitation role of Eucalyptus in South China
column5: Don’t know how this paper got into the mix. Not at all related to Chapter 1

column2: Sosa, Beatriz; Brazeiro, Alejandro
column3: Positive ecosystem engineering effects of the ant Atta vollenweideri on the shrub Grabowskia duplicata
column5: Paper looks at the density of 3 different shrub species and gives data with it and mentions facilitative effect. Can be an excellent addition

column2: Barbosa, Jomar M.; Asner, Gregory P.
column3: Prioritizing landscapes for restoration based on spatial patterns of ecosystem controls and plant-plant interactions
column5: Paper looks more at canopy density than density of the shrubs themselves but does look at facilitation itself

column2: Ballantyne, Mark; Pickering, Catherine Marina
column3: Recreational trails as a source of negative impacts on the persistence of keystone species and facilitation
column5: Paper looks at shrub densities and even states wether the density is small and large. Connects everything with facilitation. Has data that can be used for synthesis

column2: Mendez-Toribio, Moises; Maria Gonzalez-Di Pierro, Ana; Quesada, Mauricio; Benitez-Malvido, Julieta
column3: Regeneration beneath a dioecious tree species (Spondias purpurea) in a Mexican tropical dry forest
column5: Paper looks at density of woody seedlings (including shrubs) and does have measurements for density (With respect to parent woody species). Also mentions facilitative effects

column2: Mullah, Collins Jared Amwatta; Klanderud, Kari; Totland, Orjan; Kigomo, Bernard
column3: Relationships between the density of two potential restoration tree species and plant species abundance and richness in a degraded Afromontane forest of Kenya
column5: Paper looks at the association between shrub richness and density in given areas. Has A LOT on density

column2: Cipriotti, P. A.; Aguiar, M. R.
column3: Resource partitioning and interactions enable coexistence in a grass-shrub steppe
column5: Excellent paper that follows all criteria. Has shrub and shrub density in it with facilitation as a main point of the paper. Excellent to use

column2: Walker, Lawrence R.; Vrooman, Steven S.; Thompson, Daniel B.
column3: Rodent mounds facilitate shrubs and shrubs inhibit seedlings in the Mojave Desert, USA
column5: Excellent paper looking at how rodunt mounds facilitate shrubs. Looks in depth at densities of the shrubs and has data and figures to support

column2: Orrock, John L.; Christopher, Cory C.; Dutra, Humberto P.
column3: Seed bank survival of an invasive species, but not of two native species, declines with invasion
column5: Does glance into the idea of shrub density but a bit more forcus on the seeds of the species themselves

column2: Bustamante-Sanchez, Marcela A.; Armesto, Juan J.
column3: Seed limitation during early forest succession in a rural landscape on Chiloe Island, Chile: implications for temperate forest restoration
column5: Again more focus on see density itself than anything. Not the greatest

column2: Koyama, A.; Sasaki, T.; Jamsran, U.; Okuro, T.
column3: Shrub cover regulates population dynamics of herbaceous plants at individual shrub scale on the Mongolian steppe
column5: Annual density is mentioned as a side thing in this paper but isnt the main focus of it. So density is considered a bit. Not a lot of facilitation mentioned

column2: He, Yuhui; Liu, Xinping; Xie, Zhongkui
column3: SHRUB EFFECTS ON HERBACEOUS VEGETATION VARY WITH GROWTH STAGES AND HERB RELATIVE LOCATION
column5: Paper looks mainly at plant density but does look at shrub density to an extent. Also looks to see if the shrubs facilitate other vegetation near them

column2: Madrigal-Gonzalez, Jaime; Kelt, Douglas A.; Meserve, Peter L.; Squeo, Francisco A.; Gutierrez, Julio R.
column3: Shrub-ephemeral plants interactions in semiarid north-central Chile: Is the nurse plant syndrome manifested at the community level?
column5: Paper does look at density of species and connects with facilitative interactions

column2: FRANCOPIZANA, J; FULBRIGHT, TE; GARDINER, DT
column3: SPATIAL RELATIONS BETWEEN SHRUBS AND PROSOPIS-GLANDULOSA CANOPIES
column5: Great paper that looks at shrub density and its association with facilitating other woody shrubs (their establishment of other woody shrubs)

column2: Rolhauser, Andres G.; D'Antoni, Maria J.; Gabriel Gatica, M.; Pucheta, Eduardo
column3: Species-specific influences of shrubs on the non-dormant soil seed bank of native and exotic plant species in central-northern Monte Desert
column5: More focues od density of seed bank and seedlings than the shrubs themselves. Does have some data on it (Maybe use?)

column2: Hunter, John Thomas; Hunter, Vanessa Hewlett
column3: The complex nature of headland shrub encroachment: The case of Headland Zieria (Zieria prostrata)
column5: Very short paper but looks at how shrub density may provide protection to understory species and increase facilitative interactions

column2: Malkinson, D; Kadmon, R
column3: The effects of inter-plant interactions and density-dependent disturbances on vegetation pattern formation
column5: Do not have shrub density as a focus of the study but it is specifically mentioned at various portions of the paper. More focus on density of disturbances than anything. Also looks at facilitative interactions

column2: Lortie, Christopher J.; Gruber, Eva; Filazzola, Alex; Noble, Taylor; Westphal, Michael
column3: The Groot Effect: Plant facilitation and desert shrub regrowth following extensive damage
column5: Facilitation is major component of this paper. Does not specifically look at shrub density itself but does have some mentions of density of shrubs so might be useful for this paper

column2: Jordaan, J. J.
column3: The proposed colonisation sequence of woody species in the Sourish Mixed Bushveld of the Limpopo province, South Africa
column5: Paper looks more at tree density than shrub density so may not be the greatest fit for this.

column2: Yanuarsyah, I.; Suwarno, Y.; Hudjimartsu, S.
column3: The Use of Hotspot Spatial Clustering and Multitemporal Satellite Imagery to Facilitate Peat Land Degradation in West Kalimantan, Indonesia (Case Study in Mensiku Miniwatershed of Kapuas River)
column5: Paper looks at density based spatial clustering. Does mention density in it. Facilitation not heavily mentioned in paper. May not be the greatest to use

column2: Perea, Ramon; Lopez-Sanchez, Aida; Roig, Sonia
column3: The use of shrub cover to preserve Mediterranean oak dehesas: a comparison between sheep, cattle and wild ungulate management
column5: Density is a main focus of this paper but oak seedling density is, not shrub density

column2: Duncan, RS; Chapman, CA
column3: Tree-shrub interactions during early secondary forest succession in Uganda
column5: Paper looks as both shrub and tree density and how the 2 affect eachother. Has data within body of text.  Also looks to see if the densities allow for facilitation or inhibition

column2: Segoli, Moran; Ungar, Eugene D.; Giladi, Itamar; Arnon, Amir; Shachak, Moshe
column3: Untangling the positive and negative effects of shrubs on herbaceous vegetation in drylands
column5: Paper looks at herbacious species density with a bit of facilitation mentioned. Not entirely sure if it would be a good fit for the review. Does have some data on herbacious species density

column2: Mendoza-Hernandez, Pedro E.; Orozco-Segovia, Alma; Meave, Jorge A.; Valverde, Teresa; Martinez-Ramos, Miguel
column3: Vegetation recovery and plant facilitation in a human-disturbed lava field in a megacity: searching tools for ecosystem restoration
column5: Looks at density of plant species (including shrubs) and has data for it. Looks at how these densities might play a facilitative role.

column2: Williams, C. Jason; Pierson, Frederick B.; Kormos, Patrick R.; Al-Hamdan, Osama Z.; Nouwakpo, Sayjro K.; Weitz, Mark A.
column3: Vegetation, Hydrologic, and Erosion Responses of Sagebrush Steppe 9 Yr Following Mechanical Tree Removal
column5: Excellent paper that has data on sagebush density and connects it to facilitation. Follows criteria needed.

column2: Belay, Tamrat A.; Moe, Stein R.
column3: Woody dominance in a semi-arid savanna rangeland - Evidence for competitive self-thinning
column5: Paper does take a look at shrub density (calls it woody density), tree density and plant density. Also mentions facilitation as amain theme of the paper.
